pr_title: Handle gradle multiple source directories in test extension

timeline.message: Handle gradle mutliple source directories in test extension

timeline.bodyText: If a project has only one output test dir, wouldn't this dir be added twice? I.e. through this property and the default test dir that would have been added w/o this code?
timeline.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText: I check if the directory is already in the rootBuilder before adding it in order to avoid duplicate
replies.author: glefloch

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that's ok.
However, could you remind me why we did BuildToolHelper.enableGradleAppModelForTest(projectRoot)? Is this to support IDEs?
replies.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText: BuildToolHelper.enableGradleAppModelForTest(projectRoot) is already checking whether it's a gradle project, btw.
replies.author: aloubyansky

replies.bodyText:
Yes exactly if you come from the IDE the model has not been serialized yet. This is why there is those two similar blocks.
I added the check in the if because the BuildToolHelper.enableGradleAppModelForTest(projectRoot) returns null if it's not a Gradle project. You are right, it's better to check if the returned model is not null rather than checking if this a Gradle project (as the method recursively look for a build file). I will update the code
replies.author: glefloch
